intro: Solidago moseleyi, commonly known as Moseley's goldenrod, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and prairies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are bright yellow, appearing in late summer to early fall. Solidago moseleyi plays an important role in supporting pollinators like bees and butterflies during the autumn season.
